column4: i want to install "khelpcenter" for a few apps I use designed for KDE. How do I install that without the rest of KDE?
you will need the libs at least
Only arround 700 megs left. That's the broblem with a 3 gig hard drive.
get a new one ;-). They're dirt cheap these days
Not worth it. I also have a pentium 2 2**mhz processer.
it's less than a  a gig. Definitely worth it =)
I have a second (2 gig) FAT drive I haven't figured out how to use in Ubuntu yet.
/msg ubotu windowsdrives. Download and run that script -- it'll do it all for you.
I don't have any information on it that I want to keep, though. Would It work better if I reformated it to some other file system?
not if you want to transfer easily between windows and linux
OK. How do I do that, then set it up to work on here?
use gparted, then /msg ubotu windowsdrives for the automount script
actually... that script might just look for ntfs/fat drives. Better to automount it, I guess; I can talk you through it later
